item.title: 监管机构称，加州应支持燃料进口，想方设法留住炼油商
item.description: 加利福尼亚州能源监管机构周五向州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）提出建议，支持及时进口燃料，并探讨如何保留该州现有炼油厂的运营。【原文：California's energy regulator on Friday issued recommendations to Governor Gavin Newsom to support timely fuel imports and explore ways to retain operations at existing refineries in the state.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，Meta 向私人资本公司寻求 290 亿美元，用于建设人工智能数据中心
item.description: 据《金融时报》周五报道，Meta Platforms 正寻求从私人资本公司融资 290 亿美元，用于建设人工智能数据中心。【原文：Meta Platforms is seeking to raise $29 billion from private capital firms to build artificial intelligence data centers, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 特斯拉提前完成首批全自动驾驶 Model Y 交付
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周五表示，首次完全自主地将 Model Y 从工厂运送到城市另一端的客户家中，比原定计划提前一天完成。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Friday that the first fully autonomous delivery of Model Y from the factory to a customer's home across town was completed a day ahead of schedule.】

item.title: 美国航空公司称技术问题影响部分系统
item.description: 美国航空公司周五表示，一个技术问题影响了部分系统的连接，导致航班延误。【原文：American Airlines said on Friday a technology issue was affecting connectivity for some systems, causing flight delays.】

item.title: 立法者希望美国商务部调查中国智能手机制造商一加
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封信，两名美国议员周五要求商务部调查中国智能手机制造商一加在美国销售的设备是否存在安全问题。【原文：Two U.S. lawmakers on Friday asked the Commerce Department to investigate whether devices sold by Chinese smartphone maker OnePlus in the United States pose security concerns, according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国能源公司 EQT 同意以 1.675 亿美元结案
item.description: 根据原告周四向联邦法院提交的文件，美国能源公司 EQT 同意支付 1.675 亿美元，以了结投资者提起的集体诉讼，这些投资者声称 EQT 夸大了其 2017 年与莱斯能源公司（Rice Energy）67 亿美元合并的收益。【原文：U.S. energy company EQT agreed to pay $167.5 million to settle a class action lawsuit filed by investors who claimed EQT overstated the benefits of its $6.7 billion merger with Rice Energy in 2017, according to a federal court filing on Thursday by the plaintiffs.】

item.title: 白金股权投资公司支持的麦格劳希尔申请在美国上市
item.description: 由投资公司 Platinum Equity 支持的教育课程提供商麦格劳-希尔公司周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：McGraw Hill, an educational courses provider backed by investment firm Platinum Equity, filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Friday.】

item.title: 公司称，特朗普希望 EchoStar 与联邦通信委员会就无线许可证达成 "友好 "协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在本周五提交的一份文件中说，本月早些时候，他敦促 Dish TV 母公司 EchoStar Corp 和联邦通信委员会主席布兰登-卡尔（Brendan Carr）就该公司无线频谱许可证的命运达成友好协议。【原文：President Donald Trump prodded Dish TV parent EchoStar Corp and Federal Communications Commission Chair Brendan Carr earlier this month to reach an amicable deal over the fate of the company's wireless spectrum licenses, the company said in a filing on Friday.】

item.title: 美国制裁后，墨西哥 Terrafina 将取消 CIBanco 的托管人身份
item.description: 墨西哥房地产信托公司 Terrafina 周五表示，由于受到美国洗钱指控，该公司计划解除 CIBanco 银行的受托人职务，这导致墨西哥银行监管机构介入管理。【原文：Mexican real estate trust Terrafina said on Friday it planned to remove bank CIBanco as its trustee due to U.S. money laundering accusations, which resulted in Mexico's banking regulator stepping in to manage it.】

item.title: 在货币困境中，玻利维亚加密货币交易量增长超过 530
item.description: 路透社的一篇报道显示，越来越多的玻利维亚人开始转向Binance等加密货币交易所和Tether等稳定币，以对冲当地玻利瓦尔货币的贬值。【原文：Bolivia's central bank on Friday reiterated a dramatic uptick in transactions of digital assets, following a Reuters report that showed how more Bolivians were turning to crypto exchanges like Binance and stablecoins like Tether as a hedge against the depreciation of the local boliviano currency.】

item.title: 特斯拉未能终止佛罗里达州有关 Model S 致命车祸的诉讼
item.description: 特斯拉未能说服联邦法官结束对一名妇女在佛罗里达州基拉戈（Key Largo）因一辆配备自动驾驶功能的 Model S 冲出路面后被撞身亡的诉讼，这为下个月可能进行的审判铺平了道路。【原文：Tesla failed to persuade a federal judge to end a lawsuit over the death of a woman struck after an Autopilot-equipped Model S ran off the road in Key Largo, Florida, paving the way for a possible trial next month.】

item.title: 英国法庭裁定万事达卡和威士卡的商户收费违反了竞争法
item.description: 全球支付处理商威士卡公司和万事达卡公司向零售商收取的默认多边交换费违反了竞争法，伦敦一家法庭周五在这场旷日持久的法律纠纷中做出了最新裁决。【原文：Global payments processors Visa and Mastercard's default multilateral interchange fees which are charged to retailers infringe competition law, a London tribunal ruled on Friday in the latest round of the long-running legal saga.】

item.title: 贝森特：随着谈判的深入，关税协议可能在劳动节前完成
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周五表示，特朗普政府与其他国家达成的各项贸易协议可能会在9月1日劳动节假期前完成，并提到了与美国18个主要贸易伙伴的会谈，以及对与中国达成的旨在加快稀土运输的协议的新修订。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Friday the Trump administration's various trade deals with other countries could be done by the Sept. 1 Labor Day holiday, citing talks with 18 main U.S. trading partners and new revisions to a deal with China aimed at expediting rare earths shipments.】

item.title: 夏季数据为美联储降息铺平道路，或与特朗普发生进一步冲突
item.description: 上个月基本通胀率意外回升，使物价压力进一步偏离美联储设定的2%的目标，从而使今年夏天的数据成为央行能否恢复降息和缓解与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普之间持续紧张关系的焦点。【原文：An unexpected pickup in underlying inflation last month nudged price pressures further from the Federal Reserve's 2% target, putting this summer's data in the spotlight for whether the central bank can resume cutting interest rates and ease ongoing tension with President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 即时观点：华尔街在经历数月动荡后再创新高
item.description: 周五开盘时，美国 500 指数和纳斯达克综合指数创下历史新高，从美国总统唐纳德-特朗普以关税为基础的贸易政策引发的动荡期中反弹。【原文：The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite reached all-time highs at the opening bell on Friday, bouncing back from a turbulent period sparked by U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies based on tariffs.】

item.title: 比亚迪将投资 9,400 万美元，将匈牙利电动巴士产量提高两倍
item.description: 匈牙利外交部长彼得-齐雅尔托（Peter Szijjarto）表示，中国汽车制造商比亚迪将投资 320 亿福林（9400 万美元）在匈牙利北部城镇科马罗姆（Komarom）新建一座工厂，使其年产量增加两倍，达到 1,250 辆电动巴士和卡车。【原文：Chinese automaker BYD will invest 32 billion forints ($94 million) in a new plant in the northern Hungarian town of Komarom, tripling its annual capacity to 1,250 electric buses and trucks, Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto said.】

item.title: 据 Electrek 报道，特斯拉聘请前 Cruise 高管担任人工智能总监
item.description: 据新闻网站 Electrek 周四报道，特斯拉已聘请前 Cruise 高管 Henry Kuang 担任该公司的人工智能总监，该公司正寻求在美国扩大机器人出租车业务。【原文：Tesla has hired former Cruise executive, Henry Kuang, as the automaker's AI director, according to a report by news website Electrek on Thursday, as the company looks to expand robotaxi operations in the United States.】

item.title: 中国稀土再次流动，但并不自由
item.description: 尽管汽车制造商和供应商表示生产计划仍面临不确定性和持续的短缺风险，但随着中国稀土磁铁开始流通，整个汽车供应链大规模停产的威胁正在减弱。【原文：The threat of mass shutdowns across the automotive supply chain is fading as Chinese rare earth magnets begin to flow, though automakers and suppliers say production plans still face uncertainties and a continued risk of shortages.】

item.title: 迈阿密布里克尔城市中心以高达 5.487 亿美元的价格出售给西蒙地产公司
item.description: 美国购物中心所有者西蒙地产集团（Simon Property Group）周五表示，已从太古地产（Swire Properties）手中收购了迈阿密布里克尔城市中心（Brickell City Centre）的停车场和零售部分，收购价格高达 5.487 亿美元。【原文：U.S.-based shopping mall owner Simon Property Group has acquired the parking and retail segments of Miami's Brickell City Centre for up to $548.7 million from Swire Properties , the Hong Kong-listed company said on Friday.】

item.title: 据《德国商报》报道，保时捷考虑出售 MHP，估值可能超过 10 亿欧元
item.description: 德国商业日报《Handelsblatt》周五援引两位知情人士的话报道称，保时捷正在寻求出售其咨询和 IT 服务业务 MHP，该业务的估值可能超过 10 亿欧元（11.7 亿美元）。【原文：Porsche is looking to sell its consulting and IT services business MHP, which could possibly be valued at over 1 billion euros ($1.17 billion), the German business daily Handelsblatt reported on Friday, citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，微软下一代人工智能芯片生产推迟至 2026 年
item.description: 据 The Information 周五援引三位相关人士的话报道，微软的下一代 Maia 人工智能芯片将面临至少六个月的延期，量产时间将从 2025 年推迟到 2026 年。【原文：Microsoft's next-generation Maia AI chip is facing a delay of at least six months, pushing its mass production to 2026 from 2025, The Information reported on Friday, citing three people involved in the effort.】

item.title: 标普 500 指数和纳斯达克指数创下历史新高，因人工智能押注重燃，降息希望渺茫
item.description: 由于人工智能热情重燃以及宽松货币政策的前景推动美国股市从长达数月的颓势中复苏，美国 500 指数和纳斯达克综合指数周五创下历史新高。【原文：The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite hit all-time highs on Friday as renewed AI enthusiasm and the prospect of a looser monetary policy powered a recovery in U.S. stocks from months-long rout.】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州的纽瑟姆起诉福克斯新闻，就特朗普的通话提出 7.87 亿美元的诽谤索赔
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长称，该电视台在报道他与唐纳德-特朗普的通话内容时诽谤了他，因为通话内容与总统打击移民有关。【原文：California's governor said the network defamed him in covering his phone call with Donald Trump related to the president's immigration crackdown.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行首席执行官称赞特朗普可能取消报复性税收
item.description: 有迹象表明，美国共和党人可能会从其税收和支出法案中取消第 899 款报复性税收提案，巴克莱银行首席执行官对此表示欢迎。【原文：The CEO of Barclays has welcomed indications that U.S. Republicans may scrap the Section 899 retaliatory tax proposal from their tax and spending bill.】

item.title: 纳斯达克指数创历史新高，有望进入新一轮牛市
item.description: 周五，纳斯达克指数创下历史新高，因为投资者对人工智能和宽松货币政策的前景持乐观态度，纷纷涌入科技公司，使该指数有望确认牛市。【原文：The Nasdaq hit a record high on Friday, as investors piled into technology companies on optimism around artificial intelligence and the prospect for looser monetary policy, putting the index on track to confirm a bull market.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行将收购汇丰银行在德国的托管和存管业务
item.description: 法国巴黎银行周五表示，法国巴黎银行与欧洲最大银行汇丰银行达成一致，收购汇丰欧洲大陆在德国的托管和存管银行业务。【原文：BNP Paribas agreed with Europe's biggest bank HSBC to acquire the custody and depositary bank business of HSBC Continental Europe in Germany, BNP Paribas said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国参议员就葛兰素史克撤下儿童哮喘吸入器一事展开调查
item.description: 美国民主党参议员玛吉-哈桑（Maggie Hassan）周五表示，她将对英国制药巨头葛兰素史克公司（GlaxoSmithKline）决定停产一种广泛使用的儿童哮喘吸入剂一事展开调查。【原文：Democratic U.S. Senator Maggie Hassan said on Friday she is launching an investigation into British pharmaceutical giant GlaxoSmithKline's decision to discontinue a widely used asthma inhaler for children.】

item.title: 各国政府和监管机构加强对 DeepSeek 的审查
item.description: 中国人工智能初创公司 DeepSeek 今年 1 月表示，它已经开发出一种人工智能模型，可以与 ChatGPT 相媲美，而且成本更低。【原文：Chinese AI startup DeepSeek, which said in January it had developed an AI model to rival ChatGPT at much lower cost, has come under scrutiny in some countries for its security policies and privacy practices.】

item.title: 阿联酋基金购买了 1 亿美元的特朗普世界自由代币
item.description: 一家总部位于阿拉伯联合酋长国的基金购买了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普家族的加密企业世界自由金融公司（World Liberty Financial）发行的价值 1 亿美元的数字代币，成为其最大的公开投资者。【原文：A United Arab Emirates-based fund has bought $100 million worth of digital tokens issued by World Liberty Financial, the crypto venture of U.S. President Donald Trump's family, becoming its largest publicly known investor.】

item.title: 美国 5 月消费者支出意外下降
item.description: 美国消费者支出在 5 月份意外下降，原因是在征收关税之前抢先购买汽车等商品所带来的提振作用逐渐减弱，而月度通胀增幅依然温和。【原文：U.S. consumer spending unexpectedly fell in May as the boost from the pre-emptive buying of goods like motor vehicles ahead of tariffs faded, while monthly inflation increases remained moderate.】
